title: Aparência do thunderbird
content: Tenho instalado o Thunderbird o qual tenho usado como gerenciador de meus e-mails há muito tempo. A última versão que possuo vejo uma dificuldade em relação ao uso da barra de rolagem, ao lado direito, para selecionar uma mensagem qualquer etc., pois, a barra e a seta são muito pequenas, estreitas o que torna dificultoso colocar a seta do cursor em cima das mesmas e movimentar as mensagens... Pergunto: é possível aumentar o tamanho da seta e a largura da barra vertical? Aproveito para parabenizar toda a equipe que desenvolveu e dá manutenção nesse plug-in, que para mim, é o melhor disparado no que toca a gerenciar mensagens por e-mail. Muito o brigado!!!!

title: Odeslání zprávy se nezdařilo. Při odesílání zprávy došlo k chybě (SMTP).
content:
Dobrý den

V aplikaci Thunderbird verze 102.6.1 se nemohu zhruba 14 dní přihlásit k mému účtu na gmailu. Nastavení SMTP serveru a OAuth2 v aplikaci se nezměnilo a odpovídá tomuto návodu https://support.mozilla.org/cs/kb/automaticky-prevod-postovnich-uctu-google-na-overo přesto pokud o odeslání pošty skončí následující chybou (viz. obrazek): Odeslání zprávy se nezdařilo. Při odesílání zprávy došlo k chybě (SMTP). Server odpověděl: Temporary system problem. Try again later (10). go to https://support.google.com/3221692 4fb4d7fb4d7f45d1cf-5d3cc95e26esm4287881a12.20 - gsmtp

Příjem zpráv funguje a odeslání zpráv přes WEBové rozhrasnní také.

Jak mohu postupovat dál?
creator: m.fialova

title: Thunderbird Froze and when restarted it upgraded to the latest version and wiped out much of my data
content:
In the middle of using Thunderbird it froze. I restarted it and it gave me a screen asking for all of my email credentials. It then started an install of the most recent release of Thunderbird (which I was not trying to do) whereby it needed to download all of my past emails, settings, etc. My Quick Text add-on was completely deleted and much of my "Sent Email" box was deleted along with all the tags I had assigned to my emails.

I am just looking for the version of the Thunderbird I was using up until 8:00 last night. Is there a way to get back to it? This is horrific timing as well since I am at the height of my busy season with work. Any help or insight would be greatly appreciated.

Todd Catlin
creator: toddcatlin66

title: Cannot add one google account (no problems with others), oauth2 issue?
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for years with multiple google accounts on both Windows and Linux machines, no issues. On my main Windows computer one of the accounts started asking for authorization on a regular basis 2-3 months ago. I deleted the account, hoping to fix the issue, but when trying to add it back, I am stuck with this persistent issue: 

- I get to the stage Mozilla Thunderbird Email wants to access your google account. - When I click Allow, instead of finishing the setup, it brings another popup window: Authentication required - Mozilla Thunderbird. - No matter what I enter there (full gmail address, just the gmail name etc), it's not accepted, and the same window pops up again and again.

I tried to reinstall Thunderbird a couple of times, and also deleted all files inside C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Thunderbird and C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird . No change.

The issue affects only this particular computer, only this particular gmail account. All other gmail accounts work fine on this computer, and on my other computers (Linux and Widnows ones) all gmail accounts work fine, including the one which I am struggling with on the first computer.

There seems to be some caching going one which cannot be defeated by uninstalling Thunderbird and deleting the two C:\Users\xxx\AppData\*\Thunderbird folders. Where else can it be stored? Could it be Windows registry file?

Thank you in advance.
creator: pulsar124

title: Tasks view in Today Pane has wrong size
content: In the Today Pane, I use various views depending on what is shown in the rest of the Thunderbird window. Sometimes my Today Pane shows Events, sometimes Events and Tasks, and sometimes only Tasks. If one uses the Events and Tasks view in the Today Pane (left in the picture), one specifies how large the Events section is and how large the Tasks section by sliding a separator up or down. For some time now (since the release of Nebula?) I notice that, if I use the Tasks view in the Today Pane (right in the picture), the Tasks section does not fill the whole Today Pane, but its size is only that which the Tasks section has in the combined Events and Tasks view. The tasks used to fill all the space in the Today Pane by themselves, like the Events view still does (middle of picture). This seems like a bug to me. Has anyone else noticed this?

title: Slow TB syncing on Mac after using "Repair" on Inbox (8.9GB) and Sent (10.7GB) folders
content:
Dear Team,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am experiencing a significant slowdown in email synchronization in Thunderbird. Emails take a noticeably long time to appear after clicking, and the overall syncing process is extremely slow across all folders.

The problem began on Friday, December 6th, following my use of the "Repair" button on the Inbox (8.9GB) and Sent (10.7GB) folders. After initiating the repair for the Sent folder, synchronization across all folders (Inbox, Sent, Spam, etc.) slowed down considerably.

Already done: Checked "All Mail" on Google IMAP: The folder does not appear in IMAP. Troubleshoot Mode: Attempted, but it did not resolve the issue. Reinstalled Thunderbird: Uninstalled and reinstalled Thunderbird on my Mac, but the problem persists.

The issue seems isolated to Thunderbird and does not impact my Mac’s overall performance, memory usage, or speed. The synchronization delay affects only Thunderbird, while other applications function normally. I would greatly appreciate your guidance on how to resolve this issue and restore normal synchronization performance.

Thank you in advance for your support!
creator: Kostek

content:

The google POP account uses it's own folders, not the "local folders, as does all my other pop accounts in TB.
